Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the potential harm of the scam by stating that callers will be billed £315 for the phone call, while the expert's verdict mentions a charge of £15.
Understate: There is no apparent understatement bias in the claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks specific evidence or data to support the assertion that the cards are part of a premium rate telephone scam.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all cards from a company called PDS (Parcel Delivery Service) are part of a premium rate telephone scam without providing sufficient evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or possibilities for the cards received from PDS.
